results.title: Jill Bilcock: Screen Worlds Spotlight interview
results.brief_description: An interview with film editor Jill Bilcock for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Jill Bilcock is an editor known for her work on “Strictly Ballroom”, “Romeo + Juliet” and “Elizabeth”.

results.title: Yoram Gross : Screen Worlds Spotlight interview
results.brief_description: An interview with producer Yoram Gross for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Yoram Gross founded the Yoram Gross Film Studio and was known for his work on animated films and TV series including “Blinky Bill”, the “Dot” series, and “The Magic Riddle”.

results.title: Chris Doyle: Screen Worlds Spotlight interview
results.brief_description: An interview with cinematographer Chris Doyle for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Chris Doyle is a cinematographer well known for his work on films directed by Wong Kar Wai, including “Chungking Express”, “In the Mood for Love” and “Happy Together”.

results.title: Chris Masters: Screen Worlds Spotlight interview
results.brief_description: An interview with journalist Chris Masters created for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Chris Masters is an investigative journalist who has won several Gold Walkley awards and reported for the ABC’s “Four Corners”.

results.title: Back to being black
results.brief_description: John Lovett reflects on the injustices experienced by his father and so many other indigenous war veterans who were not recognised or afforded the same benefits as their white mates when they returned from service.
results.description: John Lovett reflects on the injustices experienced by his father and so many other indigenous war veterans who were not recognised or afforded the same benefits as their white mates when they returned from service.

results.title: Dr Isabel Joy Bear
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Lisetta Moscardo and Helen Simondson
results.brief_description: Isabel Joy Bear began her extensive career in science in the 1940s and today is an Honorary Fellow with CSIRO Minerals. In the 1960s Bear discovered a number of previously unknown metastable zirconium sulfate hydrates. Joy was appointed a Member of the Order of Australia in 1986 for services to science, particularly in the field of mineral chemistry. She is a fellow of both the Royal Australian Chemical Institute (RACI) and the Australasian Institute of Mining and Metallurgy, and in 1988 became the first woman to receive the Leighton Medal - the RACI’s premier award.

In the 1960s Bear discovered a number of previously unknown metastable zirconium sulfate hydrates. Joy was appointed a Member of the Order of Australia in 1986 for services to science, particularly in the field of mineral chemistry. She is a fellow of both the Royal Australian Chemical Institute (RACI) and the Australasian Institute of Mining and Metallurgy, and in 1988 became the first woman to receive the Leighton Medal - the RACI’s premier award.

Joy was appointed a Member of the Order of Australia in 1986 for services to science, particularly in the field of mineral chemistry. results.title: Black ash
results.brief_description: An account of a typical ‘lazy day’ by the river in Warburton which suddenly turns nasty when Bonnie and her friends realise the gravity of the fire. She recounts her anxiety and wanting to leave Warburton and her frustration at her family’s indecisions. She is stuck in Lysterfield after they evacuate with 17 people.

results.title: A Day to remember
results.brief_description: A young CFA volunteer who spent her 21st birthday on duty during the bushfires of February 2009. Her entire family is involved in the CFA as volunteer firefighters. She speaks about the poignancy of seeing an Australian flag on a resident’s home during ‘Black Saturday’.

results.title: Grandma Jessie
results.brief_description: In this very personal story, Stephanie King pays tribute to her Grandma Jessie and reflects on the influence her upbringing by her grandmother has had on her own education and outlook.
